intro: Henrardia persica subsp. glabriglumis, commonly known as the Persian henrardia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
